elements.desc:
Material design: [Tabs](https://www.google.com/design/spec/components/tabs.html) `paper-tabs` makes it easy to explore and switch between different views or functional aspects of an app, or to browse categorized data sets. Use `selected` property to get or set the selected tab. Example: TAB 1 TAB 2 TAB 3 See paper-tab for more information about `paper-tab`. A common usage for `paper-tabs` is to use it along with `iron-pages` to switch between different views. Tab 1 Tab 2 Tab 3
Page 1
Page 2
Page 3
 To use links in tabs, add `link` attribute to `paper-tab` and put an `` element in `paper-tab`. Example: TAB ONE TAB TWO TAB THREE ### Styling The following custom properties and mixins are available for styling: Custom property | Description | Default ----------------|-------------|---------- `--paper-tabs-selection-bar-color` | Color for the selection bar | `--paper-yellow-a100` `--paper-tabs` | Mixin applied to the tabs | `{}`

properties.name: activateEvent
properties.desc:
The event that fires from items when they are selected. Selectable
will listen for this event from items and update the selection state.
Set to empty string to listen to no events.

properties.name: addOwnKeyBinding
properties.desc:
Can be used to imperatively add a key binding to the implementing
element. This is the imperative equivalent of declaring a keybinding
in the `keyBindings` prototype property.

properties.name: alignBottom
properties.desc: If true, the tabs are aligned to bottom (the selection bar appears at the top).

properties.name: assignParentResizable
properties.desc:
Used to assign the closest resizable ancestor to this resizable
if the ancestor detects a request for notifications.

properties.name: attrForItemTitle
properties.desc:
The attribute to use on menu items to look up the item title. Typing the first
letter of an item when the menu is open focuses that item. If unset, `textContent`
will be used.

properties.name: attrForSelected
properties.desc:
If you want to use the attribute value of an element for `selected` instead of the index,
set this to the name of the attribute.

properties.name: disableDrag
properties.desc: If true, dragging on the tabs to scroll is disabled.

properties.name: focusedItem
properties.desc: Returns the currently focused item.

properties.name: hideScrollButtons
properties.desc: If true, scroll buttons (left/right arrow) will be hidden for scrollable tabs.

properties.name: indexOf
properties.desc: Returns the index of the given item.

properties.name: items
properties.desc: Returns an array of selectable items.

properties.name: keyEventTarget
properties.desc: The HTMLElement that will be firing relevant KeyboardEvents.

properties.name: multi
properties.desc: If true, multiple selections are allowed.

properties.name: noBar
properties.desc: If true, the bottom bar to indicate the selected tab will not be shown.

properties.name: noSlide
properties.desc: If true, the slide effect for the bottom bar is disabled.

properties.name: noink
properties.desc: If true, ink ripple effect is disabled.

properties.name: notifyResize
properties.desc:
Can be called to manually notify a resizable and its descendant
resizables of a resize change.

properties.name: removeOwnKeyBindings
properties.desc: When called, will remove all imperatively-added key bindings.

properties.name: resizerShouldNotify
properties.desc:
This method can be overridden to filter nested elements that should or
should not be notified by the current element. Return true if an element
should be notified, or false if it should not be notified.

params.name: element
params.desc:
A candidate descendant element that
implements `IronResizableBehavior`.

return.desc: True if the `element` should be notified of resize.

properties.name: scrollable
properties.desc: If true, tabs are scrollable and the tab width is based on the label width.

properties.name: select
properties.desc:
Selects the given value. If the `multi` property is true, then the selected state of the
`value` will be toggled; otherwise the `value` will be selected.

params.name: value
params.desc: the value to select.

properties.name: selectNext
properties.desc: Selects the next item.

properties.name: selectPrevious
properties.desc: Selects the previous item.

properties.name: selected
properties.desc: Gets or sets the selected element. The default is to use the index of the item.

properties.name: selectedAttribute
properties.desc: The attribute to set on elements when selected.

properties.name: selectedClass
properties.desc: The class to set on elements when selected.

properties.name: selectedItem
properties.desc: Returns the currently selected item.

properties.name: selectedItems
properties.desc: Returns an array of currently selected items.

properties.name: selectedValues
properties.desc:
Gets or sets the selected elements. This is used instead of `selected` when `multi`
is true.

properties.name: stopResizeNotificationsFor
properties.desc:
Used to remove a resizable descendant from the list of descendants
that should be notified of a resize change.

properties.name: _applySelection
properties.desc:
Mutates items in the menu based on provided selection details, so that
all items correctly reflect selection state.

params.name: item
params.desc: An item in the menu.

params.name: isSelected
params.desc:
True if the item should be shown in a
selected state, otherwise false.

properties.name: _excludedLocalNames
properties.desc:
The set of excluded elements where the key is the `localName`
of the element that will be ignored from the item list.

properties.name: _focusNext
properties.desc:
Focuses the next item (relative to the currently focused item) in the
menu.

properties.name: _focusPrevious
properties.desc:
Focuses the previous item (relative to the currently focused item) in the
menu.

properties.name: _focusWithKeyboardEvent
properties.desc:
Given a KeyboardEvent, this method will focus the appropriate item in the
menu (if there is a relevant item, and it is possible to focus it).

params.name: event
params.desc: A KeyboardEvent.

properties.name: _focusedItemChanged
properties.desc:
Discretely updates tabindex values among menu items as the focused item
changes.

params.name: focusedItem
params.desc: The element that is currently focused.

params.name: old
params.desc:
The last element that was considered focused, if
applicable.

properties.name: _imperativeKeyBindings
properties.desc: own properties of everything on the "prototype".

properties.name: _notifyingDescendant
properties.desc:
True if this element is currently notifying its descedant elements of
resize.

properties.name: _observeContent
properties.desc: observe content changes under the given node.

properties.name: _observeItems
properties.desc: observe items change under the given node.

properties.name: _onEscKey
properties.desc: Handler that is called when the esc key is pressed.

params.name: event
params.desc: A key combination event.

properties.name: _onFocus
properties.desc: Handler that is called when the menu receives focus.

params.name: event
params.desc: A focus event.

properties.name: _onIronItemsChanged
properties.desc:
A handler that responds to mutation changes related to the list of items
in the menu.

params.name: event
params.desc:
An event containing mutation records as its
detail.

properties.name: _onResize
properties.desc: TODO(cdata): Add `track` response back in when gesture lands.

properties.name: _onShiftTabDown
properties.desc: Handler that is called when a shift+tab keypress is detected by the menu.

params.name: event
params.desc: A key combination event.

properties.name: _parentResizable
properties.desc: The closest ancestor element that implements `IronResizableBehavior`.

properties.name: _resetTabindices
properties.desc:
Resets all tabindex attributes to the appropriate value based on the
current selection state. The appropriate value is `0` (focusable) for
the default selected item, and `-1` (not keyboard focusable) for all
other items.

properties.name: _updateMultiselectable
properties.desc:
Sets appropriate ARIA based on whether or not the menu is meant to be
multi-selectable.

params.name: multi
params.desc: True if the menu should be multi-selectable.

elements.desc:
`paper-tab` is styled to look like a tab.  It should be used in conjunction with
`paper-tabs`.

Example:

    <paper-tabs selected="0">
      <paper-tab>TAB 1</paper-tab>
      <paper-tab>TAB 2</paper-tab>
      <paper-tab>TAB 3</paper-tab>
    </paper-tabs>

### Styling

The following custom properties and mixins are available for styling:

Custom property | Description | Default
----------------|-------------|----------
`--paper-tab-ink` | Ink color | `--paper-yellow-a100`
`--paper-tab` | Mixin applied to the tab | `{}`
`--paper-tab-content` | Mixin applied to the tab content | `{}`

properties.name: active
properties.desc: If true, the button is a toggle and is currently in the active state.

properties.name: addOwnKeyBinding
properties.desc:
Can be used to imperatively add a key binding to the implementing
element. This is the imperative equivalent of declaring a keybinding
in the `keyBindings` prototype property.

properties.name: ariaActiveAttribute
properties.desc:
The aria attribute to be set if the button is a toggle and in the
active state.

properties.name: disabled
properties.desc: If true, the user cannot interact with this element.

properties.name: focused
properties.desc: If true, the element currently has focus.

properties.name: keyEventTarget
properties.desc: The HTMLElement that will be firing relevant KeyboardEvents.

properties.name: noink
properties.desc: If true, ink ripple effect is disabled.

properties.name: pointerDown
properties.desc:
True if the element is currently being pressed by a "pointer," which
is loosely defined as mouse or touch input (but specifically excluding
keyboard input).

properties.name: pressed
properties.desc: If true, the user is currently holding down the button.

properties.name: receivedFocusFromKeyboard
properties.desc:
True if the input device that caused the element to receive focus
was a keyboard.

properties.name: removeOwnKeyBindings
properties.desc: When called, will remove all imperatively-added key bindings.

properties.name: toggles
properties.desc:
If true, the button toggles the active state with each tap or press
of the spacebar.

properties.name: _asyncClick
properties.desc: event handler to unwind before triggering another event

properties.name: _changedButtonState
properties.desc: provide hook for follow-on behaviors to react to button-state

properties.name: _imperativeKeyBindings
properties.desc: own properties of everything on the "prototype".

properties.name: _pressedChanged
properties.desc: any of these changes are considered a change to button state

properties.name: _userActivate
properties.desc: 'change' events

paper-tab.desc:
`paper-tab` is styled to look like a tab.  It should be used in conjunction with
`paper-tabs`.

Example:

    <paper-tabs selected="0">
      <paper-tab>TAB 1</paper-tab>
      <paper-tab>TAB 2</paper-tab>
      <paper-tab>TAB 3</paper-tab>
    </paper-tabs>

### Styling

The following custom properties and mixins are available for styling:

Custom property | Description | Default
----------------|-------------|----------
`--paper-tab-ink` | Ink color | `--paper-yellow-a100`
`--paper-tab` | Mixin applied to the tab | `{}`
`--paper-tab-content` | Mixin applied to the tab content | `{}`

properties.desc: If true, the button is a toggle and is currently in the active state.

active state.
